title: How to Handle Customer Returns
content:
## Overview
Handling customer returns efficiently is crucial for maintaining good seller metrics and customer satisfaction.

## Step-by-Step Process

### Step 1: Review Return Request
- Log into Seller Central
- Navigate to Orders > Manage Returns
- Review the customer's return reason and comments
- Check if the return is within the 30-day return window

### Step 2: Approve or Deny Return
- For eligible returns: Click 'Authorize Request'
- For ineligible returns: Click 'Deny Request' and provide a clear explanation
- The system will automatically generate a return label for FBA items

### Step 3: Process Refund
- Once item is received and inspected
- Go to Orders > Manage Returns
- Click 'Refund' and select the appropriate refund amount
- Process within 48 hours of receiving the item

### Step 4: Update Inventory
- For FBA: Amazon automatically adds returned items back to inventory if sellable
- For FBM: Manually inspect item and update inventory accordingly
- Mark unsellable items for disposal or liquidation

## Important Notes
- Always respond to return requests within 24 hours
- Maintain a return rate below 10% to avoid account health issues
- Consider offering returnless refunds for low-value items to improve customer satisfaction

## Metrics to Monitor
- Return Dissatisfaction Rate (RDR)
- Return rate by product
- Time to process returns
